Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

The Acquisition Division at JPL supports the exploration and innovation of the Laboratory’s missions by working with our colleagues and subcontractors to provide outstanding acquisition solutions for our laboratory partners through unparalleled business performance while ensuring compliance to the Prime Contract with NASA and maintaining JPL’s financial integrity!

As a member of the University Subcontracts Section, you will be a member of the University Subcontracts Group 2. You will be responsible for being the acquisition point-of-contact, collaborating with our technical community to assist them with developing their requirements and formulating innovative acquisition strategies to ensure JPL’s success as the top tier U.S. center for robotic exploration of the solar system!

Responsibilities:

You will be a member of the University Subcontracts Section in the Acquisition Division.  Will be providing acquisition support to the segments of the Laboratory that are involved in the acquisition of research and development activities required from universities and non-profit organizations. Support includes, but is not limited to, assistance with the development and preparation of requirement documents, development of acquisition strategy, development and issuance of solicitation documents, participation in the evaluation of proposals, and development of negotiation position and strategy. You will lead negotiations or discussions with proposers, and draft all subcontract documents, assuring compliance and reviews through appropriate levels leading to subcontract issuance. You will handle required post award administrative activities including supervising and leading quality, cost, schedule, timely delivery, compliance, and socio-economic goals for the successful completion of the subcontract including close out. Interaction with internal and external personnel on significant matters often requiring the coordination of activity across interpersonal lines.

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a Bachelors degree in Business Administration, or related discipline with a minimum of 3 years of related experience; Master’s degree in similar disciplines with a minimum of 1 year of related experience; or PhD in similar fields.

  • Social skills, to include verbal and written; and computer proficiency.

  • Knowledge and application of applicable industry and/or academic practices and standards in government related subcontracting.

  • Experience with negotiating price, delivery, specifications or other terms and conditions.

  • Demonstrated ability to ensure all required items and support are delivered and received in accordance with subcontract terms, internal activities are appropriately run, and problems identified.

  • Think critically in problem resolution

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Extensive knowledge of applicable Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations.

  • Applying best business practices in a government related subcontracting environment, including source selection, conducting negotiations and management of a variety of subcontracts.

  • Demonstrated ability to stay ahead of changing technology

  • Dedication to high standards in work product

  • Work well with others in a team oriented environment

  • Reliability, and ability to work and use all available information to problem address independently, creatively and expediently

  • Knowledge of applicable laws and government regulations

  • Professional Designation in Government Contracts and Purchasing Management

  • Membership in related professional affiliations

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
